# R is a widespread tool for research

Widely used for statistical analyses in biology, math, psychology, education, ...

Also other analyses, like phylogenetics, ecological interactions, machine learning

Nice tools for figure and graph generation

---
# R is also a tool for making your academic life easier ...

Generating reports of great quality

Writing papers

Collaboration

Reproducibility and open Science

## not by itself, but when it is paired with a markup language `r emo::ji("rocket")`

Markup languages are used to generate ***human-readable***, plain-text document that use tags to define elements and give format to documents.

## `r shiny::icon("r-project")` + easy markup language

# = `r shiny::icon("r-project")` markdown!

.font2[Why create yet another markup language?]

.left[Effectively *understands* other markup
languages, i.e., you can add html, css, latex, ...]

.right[Not only ***include*** code, but ***run*** the code]

.left[Change formatting for any journal in seconds]

.right[Include citations and format them]

.left[Automatically include a reference list in any format you need]

.right[Render to different file formats, including word `r emo::ji("stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye")`]

.left[And last, but not least: <br/> &emsp; Easily add emojis and icons]
